channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Full SNAP benefits start to go out even as the Trump administration appeals
item.description: A federal judge ordered the government to fully fund food aid by Friday. The Trump administration's appeal was denied, so it's asking appealed, saying it's up to Congress to fund SNAP.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge ordered the government to fully fund food aid by Friday. The Trump administration's appeal was denied, so it's asking appealed, saying it's up to Congress to fund SNAP.

(Image credit: Nam Y. Huh)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: James Watson, who co-discovered the structure of DNA, has died at age 97
item.description: James Watson, who co-discovered the structure of DNA has died at age 97. He was a scientific superstar until he made racist remarks that made him an outcast.
item.content:encoded:
James Watson, who co-discovered the structure of DNA has died at age 97. He was a scientific superstar until he made racist remarks that made him an outcast.

(Image credit: J. Conrad Williams, Jr./Newsday)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: As millions of Americans struggle with SNAP lapses, food banks are swamped with demand
item.description: At one food pantry in Boston, the spike in demand means there's now a two-week wait for some to receive food, stressing needy families as well as pantry staff.
item.content:encoded:
At one food pantry in Boston, the spike in demand means there's now a two-week wait for some to receive food, stressing needy families as well as pantry staff.

(Image credit: Tovia Smith)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Traveling soon? What the FAA's flight reductions could mean for you
item.description: The FAA is cutting 10% of air traffic at 40 of the nation's busiest airports, canceling hundreds of flights and creating uncertainty for many more passengers. Here's what to do if you're one of them.
item.content:encoded:
The FAA is cutting 10% of air traffic at 40 of the nation's busiest airports, canceling hundreds of flights and creating uncertainty for many more passengers. Here's what to do if you're one of them.

(Image credit: Timothy A. Clary)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: OpenAI's new web browser has ChatGPT baked in. That's raising some privacy questions
item.description: The Atlas browser can act as your "agent" online, doing tasks like shopping or booking tickets. But that gives it access to a lot of personal information.
item.content:encoded: The Atlas browser can act as your "agent" online, doing tasks like shopping or booking tickets. But that gives it access to a lot of personal information.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: The FAA's air traffic reductions are taking effect. Here's what to know
item.description: Airlines are canceling hundreds of flights to comply with the FAA's order. But there are still questions about the plan, which the agency says will keep the skies safe during the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded:
Airlines are canceling hundreds of flights to comply with the FAA's order. But there are still questions about the plan, which the agency says will keep the skies safe during the government shutdown.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Multiple explosions shake a mosque in an Indonesian high school, injuring dozens
item.description: Indonesian authorities said they have identified a 17-year-old boy as the suspected perpetrator of an attack that shook a mosque at a high school during Friday prayers in Jakarta.
item.content:encoded:
Indonesian authorities said they have identified a 17-year-old boy as the suspected perpetrator of an attack that shook a mosque at a high school during Friday prayers in Jakarta.

(Image credit: Dita Alangkara)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why next year's flu shot might not be as good as it should be
item.description: America's withdrawal from the World Health Organization is affecting the ability of U.S. scientists to track flu and other pathogens. That could be a blow to the development of the 2025 flu vaccine.
item.content:encoded:
America's withdrawal from the World Health Organization is affecting the ability of U.S. scientists to track flu and other pathogens. That could be a blow to the development of the 2025 flu vaccine.

(Image credit: Centers for Disease Control/Smith Collection/Gado)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: FAA to reduce air traffic by 10%. And, Trump administration plans to appeal SNAP ruling
item.description: The FAA plans to reduce air traffic by 10% at busy airports. And, a federal judge orders the Trump administration to fully restore SNAP food benefits by today, which it plans to appeal.
item.content:encoded:
The FAA plans to reduce air traffic by 10% at busy airports. And, a federal judge orders the Trump administration to fully restore SNAP food benefits by today, which it plans to appeal.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Under RFK Jr., the CDC is scrutinizing the childhood vaccine schedule
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has launched an unprecedented review of routine shots given to kids, alarming public health experts.
item.content:encoded:
Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has launched an unprecedented review of routine shots given to kids, alarming public health experts.

(Image credit: Jan Sonnenmair)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein
